alert.note: Alert for Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 6:23PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Pitkin between Carbondale and Redstone. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Kline Creek, Crystal River, North Thompson Creek, Bulldog Creek, Hayes Creek, Coal Creek, East Creek, Spring Creek, South Thompson Creek, Braderich Creek, Middle Thompson Creek, Perham Creek, South Branch Middle Thompson Creek, Prince Creek and Avalanche Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redstone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
